storyTitle: As a new employee, I want to view required documents for the I-9 form to ensure I have everything needed.

testCases.title: Verify required documents are listed clearly on the landing page
preconditions: User has access to the I-9 landing page URL
User is authenticated as a new employee
I-9 landing page is deployed and accessible
Required documents list is populated in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the I-9 landing page
steps.expectedResult: I-9 landing page loads successfully and displays the main content

steps.action: Locate the 'Required Documents' section on the landing page
steps.expectedResult: 'Required Documents' section is visible and clearly labeled on the page

steps.action: Review the list of required documents displayed
steps.expectedResult: A complete list of acceptable I-9 documents is displayed with clear formatting and organization

steps.action: Verify that document names are clearly readable and properly formatted
steps.expectedResult: All document names are displayed in readable font size, proper spacing, and logical grouping

steps.action: Check if the documents are categorized (List A, List B, List C)
steps.expectedResult: Documents are organized into appropriate categories with clear category headers

postconditions: User can identify all required documents for I-9 completion
No errors or broken elements are present on the page

testCases.title: Verify each document link is functional and leads to the correct resource
preconditions: User is on the I-9 landing page
Required documents section is visible
All document links are configured in the system
Target document resources are available

steps.action: Identify all clickable document links in the Required Documents section
steps.expectedResult: All document links are visually identifiable (underlined, colored, or with icons)

steps.action: Click on the first document link in the list
steps.expectedResult: Link is clickable and initiates navigation or download action

steps.action: Verify the document opens or downloads correctly
steps.expectedResult: Correct document opens in a new tab/window or downloads to the device with proper filename

steps.action: Return to the I-9 landing page and repeat steps 2-3 for each remaining document link
steps.expectedResult: Each document link successfully opens or downloads the corresponding correct document

steps.action: Verify that no broken links (404 errors) are present
steps.expectedResult: All links resolve successfully without error messages

steps.action: Check that external links open in new tabs/windows
steps.expectedResult: External document links open in new browser tabs, preserving the original I-9 landing page

postconditions: All document links have been verified as functional
User can successfully access all required document resources
Original I-9 landing page remains accessible

testCases.title: Verify users can easily understand the categories of documents required
preconditions: User is on the I-9 landing page
User has no prior knowledge of I-9 document requirements
Required Documents section is fully loaded
Document categories are configured in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the Required Documents section on the I-9 landing page
steps.expectedResult: Required Documents section is displayed with clear heading

steps.action: Review the document category structure (List A, List B, List C)
steps.expectedResult: Document categories are clearly labeled with distinct headings or visual separators

steps.action: Read the explanation or description provided for each document category
steps.expectedResult: Each category includes a clear explanation of what types of documents belong to that category and their purpose

steps.action: Verify that List A explanation indicates documents that establish both identity and employment authorization
steps.expectedResult: List A description clearly states these documents prove both identity and work authorization

steps.action: Verify that List B explanation indicates documents that establish identity only
steps.expectedResult: List B description clearly states these documents prove identity only

steps.action: Verify that List C explanation indicates documents that establish employment authorization only
steps.expectedResult: List C description clearly states these documents prove employment authorization only

steps.action: Check for instructions on which combination of documents is acceptable
steps.expectedResult: Clear instructions state that employees must provide either one List A document OR one List B document AND one List C document

steps.action: Look for any visual aids (icons, colors, diagrams) that help distinguish categories
steps.expectedResult: Visual elements are present and enhance understanding of document categories

postconditions: User understands the three document categories
User knows which combination of documents they need to provide
User can make informed decisions about which documents to prepare

testCases.title: Verify user can download necessary forms from the Required Documents section
preconditions: User is on the I-9 landing page
Required Documents section is accessible
Downloadable forms are available in the system
User has appropriate browser permissions for downloads

steps.action: Navigate to the Required Documents section
steps.expectedResult: Required Documents section is displayed with all available forms

steps.action: Identify forms that are available for download (e.g., I-9 form, instructions)
steps.expectedResult: Downloadable forms are clearly marked with download icons or labels

steps.action: Click on the download link for the I-9 form
steps.expectedResult: Download initiates immediately or download dialog appears

steps.action: Verify the downloaded file is saved to the default download location
steps.expectedResult: File is successfully downloaded with correct filename (e.g., 'I-9_Form.pdf')

steps.action: Open the downloaded form
steps.expectedResult: Form opens correctly in appropriate application (PDF reader) and is readable and complete

steps.action: Return to the page and download any additional available forms
steps.expectedResult: All additional forms download successfully with correct filenames and content

postconditions: User has successfully downloaded all necessary forms
Downloaded forms are accessible and usable
User can proceed with form completion offline if needed

testCases.title: Verify Required Documents section is accessible from the I-9 landing page navigation
preconditions: User is on the I-9 landing page
Page has fully loaded
Required Documents section exists on the page

steps.action: Load the I-9 landing page
steps.expectedResult: I-9 landing page displays with all sections visible

steps.action: Locate the 'Required Documents' section link or button in the navigation or page content
steps.expectedResult: 'Required Documents' link/button is clearly visible and labeled

steps.action: Click on the 'Required Documents' section link
steps.expectedResult: Page scrolls to or navigates to the Required Documents section smoothly

steps.action: Verify the Required Documents section content is fully displayed
steps.expectedResult: Complete list of required documents with categories and explanations is visible

postconditions: User is viewing the Required Documents section
All document information is accessible

testCases.title: Verify document links remain functional after page refresh
preconditions: User is on the I-9 landing page
Required Documents section is visible
Browser supports page refresh functionality

steps.action: Navigate to the Required Documents section
steps.expectedResult: Required Documents section is displayed with all document links

steps.action: Click on any document link to verify it works
steps.expectedResult: Document link opens or downloads successfully

steps.action: Refresh the browser page (F5 or refresh button)
steps.expectedResult: Page reloads successfully and Required Documents section is still visible

steps.action: Click on the same document link again
steps.expectedResult: Document link still functions correctly and opens/downloads the document

steps.action: Test multiple document links after refresh
steps.expectedResult: All document links remain functional after page refresh

postconditions: All document links are functional after page refresh
Page state is maintained correctly

testCases.title: Verify error handling when document link is broken or unavailable
preconditions: User is on the I-9 landing page
Test environment allows simulation of broken links
At least one document link is configured to be broken or unavailable

steps.action: Navigate to the Required Documents section
steps.expectedResult: Required Documents section is displayed

steps.action: Click on a broken or unavailable document link
steps.expectedResult: System detects the broken link

steps.action: Observe the error message or notification displayed
steps.expectedResult: User-friendly error message is displayed indicating the document is temporarily unavailable

steps.action: Verify that the error message provides alternative actions or contact information
steps.expectedResult: Error message includes helpful information such as 'Please contact HR' or 'Try again later'

steps.action: Verify that the page does not crash or become unresponsive
steps.expectedResult: Page remains functional and other document links are still accessible

postconditions: User is informed of the issue
User can continue accessing other documents
Page remains stable

testCases.title: Verify Required Documents section displays correctly on mobile devices
preconditions: User has access to a mobile device or mobile emulator
I-9 landing page is responsive
User can access the I-9 landing page on mobile

steps.action: Open the I-9 landing page on a mobile device (or use browser mobile emulation)
steps.expectedResult: Page loads and adapts to mobile screen size

steps.action: Scroll to the Required Documents section
steps.expectedResult: Required Documents section is visible and properly formatted for mobile view

steps.action: Verify that all document names are readable without horizontal scrolling
steps.expectedResult: Text wraps appropriately and is fully readable on mobile screen

steps.action: Verify that document categories are clearly separated and distinguishable
steps.expectedResult: Category headers and document lists are properly formatted with adequate spacing

steps.action: Tap on a document link
steps.expectedResult: Link is easily tappable (adequate touch target size) and opens/downloads the document

steps.action: Test multiple document links on mobile
steps.expectedResult: All links are functional and accessible on mobile device

postconditions: Required Documents section is fully functional on mobile
User experience is optimized for mobile viewing

testCases.title: Verify document list updates reflect the latest acceptable documents from HR
preconditions: HR has provided an updated list of acceptable I-9 documents
Updated document list has been loaded into the system
User has access to the I-9 landing page
Previous version of document list is known for comparison

steps.action: Obtain the latest list of acceptable I-9 documents from HR
steps.expectedResult: Current official list of acceptable documents is available for reference

steps.action: Navigate to the Required Documents section on the I-9 landing page
steps.expectedResult: Required Documents section is displayed

steps.action: Compare each document listed on the page with the official HR list
steps.expectedResult: All documents on the page match the official HR list exactly

steps.action: Verify that no outdated or deprecated documents are listed
steps.expectedResult: Only current, acceptable documents are displayed

steps.action: Check that any newly added acceptable documents are included
steps.expectedResult: All new documents from the updated HR list are present on the page

steps.action: Verify document descriptions match current HR guidelines
steps.expectedResult: All document descriptions and category assignments are accurate and current

postconditions: Document list is current and compliant with HR requirements
No outdated information is displayed to users

testCases.title: Verify accessibility of Required Documents section for users with disabilities
preconditions: User has access to screen reader software or accessibility testing tools
I-9 landing page is loaded
Accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1) are defined as requirements

steps.action: Enable screen reader software (e.g., JAWS, NVDA)
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader is active and functioning

steps.action: Navigate to the I-9 landing page using keyboard only (Tab key)
steps.expectedResult: Page is navigable using keyboard without requiring mouse

steps.action: Tab to the Required Documents section
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces the Required Documents section heading clearly

steps.action: Navigate through the document list using keyboard
steps.expectedResult: Each document link is reachable via Tab key and screen reader announces link text

steps.action: Verify that document categories are announced by screen reader
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader clearly announces category headings (List A, List B, List C)

steps.action: Press Enter on a document link using keyboard
steps.expectedResult: Document opens or downloads successfully using keyboard interaction only

steps.action: Check color contrast of text and links using accessibility tools
steps.expectedResult: All text meets WCAG 2.1 AA contrast ratio requirements (4.5:1 for normal text)

steps.action: Verify that all images or icons have appropriate alt text
steps.expectedResult: Screen reader announces meaningful alt text for all visual elements

postconditions: Required Documents section is fully accessible to users with disabilities
Section meets WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards
